title: Kristen Bell and Idina Menzel pose in front of their Frozen characters for sweet selfie on Instagram
text:
The first film's unprecedented success took everyone by surprise, including Disney, the studio that released it.

Now Frozen II is on the brink of hitting theaters next month.

To celebrate, the film's stars Kristen Bell and Idina Menzel posed in front of statues of their characters Anna and Elsa, respectively, in an Instagram post shared by Bell.

Snow sisters: Kristen Bell posted a sweet selfie with Idina Menzel to Instagram on Friday, posing in front of real-life statues of their characters from the Frozen films

The tale is inspired by the classic Hans Christian Andersen characters from The Snow Queen.

In the original 2013 film Frozen, the pair dealt with Elsa's burgeoning magical powers that allow her to control ice, snow and water.

And the film enjoyed enthusiastic reviews and a staggeringly high box office take thanks to its female-centric characters and storyline.

Musical theater star Menzel's pipes also had something to do with it, as she sung the huge hit song from the first film, Let It Go.

Now the pair are returning for the sequel, which welcomes back voice actors like Josh Gad and Jonathan Groff, and brings on new talent as well, like Evan Rachel Wood, Sterling K. Brown and Jason Ritter.

Take that: Both Bell and Menzel couldn't be more excited about the sequel's upcoming release, as seen on their respective Instagram accounts

Enchanted star Menzel has also been quite vocal on social media about the impending release of Frozen II.

On Wednesday, she posted a selfie that showed her covered in bejeweled icicles and snowflakes, from the shoot for her new Season Of Love holiday album.

In an obvious nod to Frozen II, she captioned the snap, 'Once an ice queen, always an ice queen. ❄️'

And earlier in the week, she uploaded a poster for the new film that showed her character Elsa in the midst of some serious icicle-magic-making, captioning it with 'Elsa is no joke in this movie. #Frozen2'

Ice queen, snow queen: On Wednesday, Idina posted a selfie that showed her covered in bejeweled icicles and snowflakes, in an obvious nod to Frozen II

She has also regularly posted trailers for the animated film along with snippets that tease a new song from the release, titled Into The Unknown.

But the 'Frozen sisters' aren't the only ones getting excited about the new movie — Kristen's husband Dax Shepard is also an obvious fan.

Last week both he and Bell shared a photo of the Bless This Mess comedian kissing the statue of his wife's character.

Frozen II is due in theaters just in time for Thanksgiving, on November 22.
description: Frozen II is on the brink of hitting theaters next month, and the original film's stars Kristen Bell and Idina Menzel couldn't be more excited about it, as seen on their respective Instagram accounts.
